paper_abstract: The increasing number of digitized texts presently available notably on the Web has developed an acute need in text mining techniques Clustering systems are used more and mole often in text mining especially to analyze texts and to extract knowledge they contain With the availability of the vast amount of clustering algorithms and techniques it becomes highly confusing to a user to choose the algorithm that best suits its target data set Actually it is very hard to define which algorithms work the best since results depend considerably on the application and on the kinds of data at hand In this impel we propose study and compare three text clustering methods an ascending hierarchieal clustering method a SOM-based clustering method and an ant-based clustering method all of these based on the synsets of WordNet as twins tom the representation of textual documents The effects of these methods ale examined in several experiments using 3 similarity measurements the cosine distance the Euclidean distance and the manhattan distance The reuters-21578 corpus is used to, evaluation The evaluation was done by using the F-measure The results obtained show that the SOM-based clustering method using the cosine distance provides the best results
paper_title: Evaluation of Text Clustering Methods Using WordNet
